intro: Psephellus somcheticus, commonly known as the Thai mountain pincushion, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spherical inflorescence composed of numerous small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and is adapted to high-altitude environments with cooler temperatures. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its stem is often hairy and robust. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
